benchmark: Only ~14 Indian SaaS have reached $100M ARR (≈INR 8M MRR); log-scale handles wide range.
source: BVP Atlas: 'The Rise of SaaS in India 2023 Report'

benchmark: Targeting $10M ARR (INR 80M) is a significant milestone for Indian SaaS.
source: Accel India: 'State of Indian SaaS 2024 Report', SaaSBOOMi Annual Reports

benchmark: Indian SaaS often run with high capital efficiency; lean operations typical.
source: Blume Ventures: 'India SaaS Landscape 2023', BVP Atlas: 'The Rise of SaaS in India 2023 Report'

benchmark: 12–18 months runway is standard in India.
source: McKinsey & Company India: 'Turning India into a SaaS Powerhouse', PwC India Startup Outlook 2024

benchmark: Indian SaaS typically see 70–80% margins.
source: India SaaS Survey 2023 (e.g., conducted by SaaSBOOMi/KPMG), Zinnov-NASSCOM Indian SaaS Landscape Report

benchmark: Positive operating margins (15-30%) are highly valued for sustainability in India.
source: KPMG India: 'Startup Funding & Valuations Report', SaaSBOOMi: 'Scaling SaaS in India Playbook'

benchmark: Indian SaaS target 50–70% YoY growth; global median ~30%.
source: Bain & Company India: 'India SaaS Report 2023', McKinsey & Company: 'The Rule of 40 in SaaS'

benchmark: Sequoia Surge recommends fast user expansion (20–50%).
source: Sequoia Surge Program Guidelines, Lightspeed India: 'Consumer Tech Trends in India'

benchmark: B2B conversion rates vary (5-15%) based on lead quality and sales cycle.
source: HubSpot: 'State of Inbound Report', Sales Enablement Pro: 'Indian Sales Efficiency Benchmarks'

benchmark: Average B2B SaaS conversions ~14–25%.
source: ChartMogul: 'SaaS Metrics Report', OpenView Partners: 'Product-Led Growth Benchmarks'

benchmark: Indicates efficiency of converting new signups into revenue, target 5% or higher.
source: Product-Led Growth (PLG) Community India Forum Discussions, OpenView Partners

benchmark: Healthy expansion revenue (10-20% of MRR) drives NRR.
source: SaaSBOOMi: 'Growth Playbook for Indian SaaS', Freshworks Investor Relations Reports

benchmark: Product-led SaaS aim for CAC < ₹50k.
source: Sequoia Capital India: 'Startup Metrics Benchmarks', Tracxn CRM Analysis (Indian Market)

benchmark: Median customer lifetime ~24 months in Indian SaaS.
source: India SaaS Survey 2023 (e.g., conducted by SaaSBOOMi/KPMG)

benchmark: Ideal benchmark is 3:1 LTV:CAC, so a ratio of 1/3 = 0.33 is good for scoring.
source: BCG India: 'SaaS Benchmarks Report', Bain & Company: 'Global SaaS Report'

benchmark: Aim for <12 months payback period, especially for enterprise SaaS in India.
source: Indian SaaS Investment Playbook (e.g., from top VC firms like Accel, Lightspeed)

benchmark: High contribution margins (60%+) are crucial for scaling profitability.
source: SaaS Metrics for Indian Startups (e.g., from industry analysts like Zinnov)

benchmark: Annual churn <10% (enterprise) or <5% (SMB); 5% monthly = danger zone.
source: Stellaris Venture Partners: 'How Founders Assess Churn', SaaSBOOMi: 'Retention Playbook'

benchmark: Similar to logo churn, but focuses on revenue lost; aiming for <10% annually.
source: SaaSBOOMi Annual Reports, Gainsight: 'State of Customer Success Report'

benchmark: Top Indian SaaS report NRR in 120–130% range.
source: BCG India: 'Lean Scaling in SaaS Report', Accel India: 'SaaS Metrics That Matter'

kpi: Daily Active Users / Monthly Active Users (DAU/MAU)
benchmark: Healthy engagement typically means DAU/MAU > 20-30% for consumer apps, higher for B2B tools.
source: Product-led Growth (PLG) Insights, Mixpanel: 'Product Benchmarks Report'

benchmark: Crucial for early stickiness; target >30-40% depending on product.
source: Mobile App Analytics Reports (e.g., Adjust, Branch), Indian Consumer Tech Reports

benchmark: Longer-term stickiness; target >20-30% depending on product.
source: Mobile App Analytics Reports (e.g., Adjust, Branch), Indian Consumer Tech Reports

benchmark: Strong founder involvement leads to better outcomes.
source: Sequoia Surge Program Guidelines, Accel India: 'Founder's Playbook'

benchmark: Optimal team size varies, but 20-50 for early growth stage is common.
source: Indian Startup Ecosystem Reports (e.g., NASSCOM Startup Report, IVCA Reports)

formula: Daily: 100, Weekly: 80, Bi-Weekly: 60, Monthly: 40, Quarterly: 20, Irregular: 0
benchmark: Regular and frequent KPI updates indicate strong operational rigor.
source: Startup Best Practices Guides (e.g., Y Combinator Playbook, Startup Grind India)

benchmark: Recent fundraise (within 12-18 months) shows investor confidence and capital availability.
source: Indian VC Funding Trends Reports (e.g., IVCA-Bain Report, Venture Intelligence)

benchmark: High ARR per FTE (e.g., ₹20 Lakhs+) indicates strong team efficiency.
source: SaaSBOOMi: 'Indian SaaS Benchmarking Report', Zinnov-NASSCOM Indian SaaS Landscape

benchmark: NPS > 50 is excellent, >30 is good for Indian SaaS.
source: CustomerGauge: 'Global NPS Benchmarks', Indian Customer Experience Reports (e.g., Forrester India)

benchmark: CSAT > 80% is generally considered good.
source: Zendesk: 'CX Trends Report', Indian Customer Support Benchmarks (e.g., from Freshdesk)

benchmark: Low ticket volume per user/customer indicates product ease of use.
source: Customer Support Best Practices Guides (e.g., Intercom, Help Scout)

benchmark: Aim for resolution within 24-48 hours for most issues.
source: Customer Support Best Practices Guides (e.g., Intercom, Help Scout)

benchmark: Strong onboarding correlates with lower churn.
source: BCG India: 'Lean Scaling in SaaS Report', Product-Led Growth (PLG) principles
